caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 27.
Pachynus denticulatum Lowry, 1984
. Female, 4.0 mm, MV J62422, Bass Strait, Tasmania, Australia. Scales represent 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 28. Posteroventral corner of epimeron 3. a :
Pachynus denticulatum Lowry, 1984
, holotype, 3.4 mm, AM P.24232, off Malabar, New South Wales, Australia; b :
P. denticulatum
, female, 2.8 mm, AM P.46676, off Horseshoe, Reef, Bootless Bay, Papua New Guinea; c :
P. pugilator Lowry, 1984
, female, 3.6 mm, MV J62416, Crib Point, Western Port, Victoria, Australia.

Diagnostic description. Head lateral cephalic lobe small, subacute; ventral margin curved. Antenna 1 peduncular article 1 without posterodistal spine; accessory flagellum absent ; flagellum with weak 1-field callynophore in female, strong 1-field callynophore in male. Mandible lacinia mobilis a simple robust seta; lamina dentata absent; accessory setal row present, not on raised setose ridge; molar absent ; palp attached midway; palp article 2 slender, longer than article 3; article 3 with subparallel margins.
Maxilla 1 outer plate with 8 setal-teeth
in 5/3 arrangement, setal-teeth smooth; palp well developed, 2-articulate, with apical robust setae. Maxilliped inner plate small; outer plate small; palp 4-articulate, article 4 large. Gnathopod 1 chelate; ischium smaller than propodus, not swollen posteroproximally; carpus extremely compressed; propodus length about 1.6 × breadth, posterior margin well developed, with produced corner, corner of palm with complex robust seta; dactylus reaching to corner of palm. Gnathopod 2 propodus, length more than 2 × breadth, palm minute, transverse. Pereonite 4 without dorsal spines. Pereonite 5 without dorsal spines. Pereopod 5 merus with posteroproximal shoulder. Pereopod 6 basis with posteroventral lobe produced beyond ischium; merus broader than long, with posteroproximal shoulder. Pereopod 7 basis subquadrate, about 1.5 × as long as wide with posterior margin weakly dentate. Epimeron 3 posterior margin without projections, posteroventral corner acutely produced. Uropod 3 biramous, inner ramus just reaching base of article 2 of outer ramus.
Telson
longer than broad, entire.

Remarks.
Pachynus denticulatum
and
P. pugilator
both have the epimeron 3 posteroventral corner acutely produced. They differ in the accessory flagellum (present in
P. pugilator
, absent in
P. denticulatum
); in mandibular palp article 2 (subequal to article 3 in
P. pugilator
, longer in
P. denticulatum
); and in the shape of the pereopod 5 basis (subovate in
P. pugilator
, subquadrate in
P. denticulatum
). The shape of the epimeron 3 posteroventral corner varies slightly, as shown in fig. 28.
Distribution. Southern Papua New Guinea and south-eastern Australia , western South Pacific Ocean; 25–120 m depth.
